REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.delete_user(user_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), owner: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Delete user by their ID, with not active state. Allowed for roles: admin.

Parameters:

  • user_id (int) – id of user

  • owner (User, optional) – _description_, defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user)

  • db (Session, optional) – _description_, defaults to Depends(get_db)

  • db (Session) – The database session.

REST API routes Comments¶

async src.routes.comments.create_comment(body: CommentBase, image_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), owner: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The create_comment function creates a new comment in the database.

The function takes an image_id and a body as input, and returns the created comment.

Parameters:

  • body – CommentBase: Get the data from the request body

  • image_id – int: Get the image id from the path

  • owner – User: Get the current user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

A commentbase object

async src.routes.comments.get_comment(image_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), comment_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), owner: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_comment function returns a comment by its id.

Parameters:

  • image_id – int: Get the image id from the url

  • comment_id – int: Get the comment id from the url

  • owner – User: Check if the user is logged in

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

A comment object

async src.routes.comments.get_comments(image_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), limit: int = Query(5), offset: int = 0, owner: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_comments function returns a list of comments for the image with the given id. The limit and offset parameters are used to paginate through all comments.

Parameters:

  • image_id – int: Get the image id from the url

  • limit – int: Limit the number of comments that are returned

  • offset – int: Get the next set of comments

  • owner – User: Get the current user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository_comments

Returns:

A list of comments for a given image

async src.routes.comments.remove_comment(image_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), comment_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), owner: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The remove_comment function removes a comment from an image.

Allowed for roles: admin and moderator.

Parameters:

  • image_id – int: Get the image id from the url

  • comment_id – int: Identify which comment to remove

  • owner – User: Get the current user and check if they are authorized to delete the comment

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

A comment object

async src.routes.comments.update_comment(body: CommentBase, image_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), comment_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), owner: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The update_comment function updates a comment in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – CommentBase: Pass the data of the comment that will be updated

  • image_id – int: Get the image id from the url

  • comment_id – int: Identify the comment that is to be updated

  • owner – User: Get the current user

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A comment

REST API repository Comments¶

async src.repository.comments.create_comment(body: CommentBase, image_id: int, owner: User, db: Session) → Comment | None¶

The create_comment function creates a new comment for an image.

Parameters:

  • body – CommentBase: Pass in the comment object from the request body

  • image_id – int: Get the image id from the database

  • owner – User: Get the user that is making the comment

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A comment object

async src.repository.comments.get_comment_by_id(image_id: int, comment_id: int, db: Session) → Comment | None¶

The get_comment_by_id function returns a comment by its id.

Parameters:

  • image_id – int: Filter the comments by image_id

  • comment_id – int: Filter the comments by their id

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A comment object or none

async src.repository.comments.get_comments(image_id: int, limit: int, offset: int, db: Session) → List[Comment]¶

The get_comments function returns a list of comments for the image with the given id. The limit and offset parameters are used to paginate through results.

Parameters:

  • image_id – int: Filter the comments by image_id

  • limit – int: Limit the number of comments returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of comments to skip before returning the results

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of comment objects

async src.repository.comments.get_image_by_id(image_id: int, db: Session)¶

The get_image_by_id function returns an image object from the database, given its id.

Parameters:

  • image_id – int: Specify the id of the image that is being requested

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A single image object from the database

async src.repository.comments.remove_comment(image_id: int, comment_id: int, owner: User, db: Session) → Comment | None¶

The remove_comment function removes a comment from the database.

Parameters:

  • image_id – int: Find the image that the comment is on

  • comment_id – int: Identify the comment to be removed

  • owner – User: Check if the user is the owner of the comment

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A comment object or none

async src.repository.comments.update_comment(image_id: int, comment_id: int, body: CommentBase, owner: User, db: Session) → Comment | None¶

The update_comment function updates a comment in the database.

Parameters:

  • image_id – int: Identify the image that the comment belongs to

  • comment_id – int: Filter the comment that is being updated

  • body – CommentBase: Pass the new comment to the function

  • owner – User: Check if the user is the owner of the comment

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A comment object or none
